title: North High School - Orientation
author: NHS Administration
finalMessage: Thanks for completing orientation. We look forward to seeing you in August!

items.title: Welcome to orientation ðŸ‘‹
items.body:
As we're unable to meet in-person this summer, we've organized a short online overview of essential information regarding the upcoming school year.

This orientation is structured as a course, and we'll ask you a few questions along the way to highlight the most important items.

We appreciate you reviewing these materials carefully, and look forward to seeing you all in August!

items.title: But first, a message from your principal:
items.body:
Welcome to the North High School community!

While there is still a lot of uncertainty about how COVID-19 will impact the coming school year, please know that you are in good hands and that we will support each other through this.

At North, we like to say that we Row Together!

- Principal Scott Wolf

items.title: A quick introduction to North High School

items.prompt: Which of the following statements are true?
items.hint: Go back and rewatch the "Celebrations" portion of the video. Remember that you can select more than one correct answer!
options: Our 4-year graduation rate of 85.9% is well above the school district average
Over 7 years, our graduation rate is over 99%
There are no gaps in graduation rates with students of color or English Language Learners
We've achieved all of the above while growing from 770 to 1500 students (over 8 years)
solution: Our 4-year graduation rate of 85.9% is well above the school district average
Over 7 years, our graduation rate is over 99%
There are no gaps in graduation rates with students of color or English Language Learners
We've achieved all of the above while growing from 770 to 1500 students (over 8 years)

items.title: Please read this document explaining our mission

items.prompt: Which of the following statements is *not* true?
items.hint: Reread the "Rigorous, Personalized Academics" section of the last document.
options: We want to see 100% of students involved in an extracurricular club, sport, or activity
All students are provided with a Chromebook at the start of the school year
Students are expected to select their courses without any help from the school
We offer Saturday school every week for students who want to get ahead or get caught up
items.solution: Students are expected to select their courses without any help from the school

items.title: Our *tentative* calendar for the school year
...But it's possible some dates will change
items.body:
At North, we try to follow this calendar as closely as possible, but it's possible some dates may change. We will have more information concerning the schedule in August, but this calendar will give you a general idea of when students are expected to be in school.

At this time, we anticipate starting in-person classes as scheduled, but we have three different plans in place depending on how COVID-19 plays out:

Plan A: Traditional In-Person Learning

Plan B: Hybrid In-Person and Remote Learning

Plan C: Fully Remote Learning

We are currently moving forward with Plan A. That said, we need to be ready to execute on Plan B or C at any time and we may go back and forth between plans, as needed, throughout the year.

items.prompt: Which statement about our calendar is most accurate?
items.hint: Go back and review the last section.
options: All of the dates are 100% certain
Some of the dates might change, but we'll know for sure in August
We expect all of the dates to change
items.solution: Some of the dates might change, but we'll know for sure in August

items.prompt: Which of the following plans are we considering for this school year?
items.hint: Go back and review our plans for the school year.
options: A combination of in-person and remote learning
solution: A combination of in-person and remote learning
